1.title: The Lovely Bones/The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus/The White Ribbon
1.plot: Brett and Ellen review The White Ribbon, The Lovely Bones and The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus; we've got a message from the Monsters Union, the Top 5 Couples Who Should Break-Up because of Leap Year and Ellen defends teenage movie bad-asses due to Youth in Revolt.

2.title: Daybreakers/Leap Year/Youth in Revolt
2.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Daybreakers," "Leap Year," and "Youth in Revolt," Brett breaks down the Top 5 Badasses in the Movies and Matthew Broderick shares his Five Favorite Films.

3.title: The Book of Eli/The Spy Next Door/Fish Tank
3.plot: This Week, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of The Book of Eli (2010), The Spy Next Door (2010) and Fish Tank (2009). Then we count down the Top 5 Best Harrison Ford Quotes AND have Brendan Fraser's Five Favorite Films from Extraordinary Measures. And we ask the cast of _Legion (2009)_ how to Appease An Angry God.

4.title: Extraordinary Measures/Legion/Crazy Heart
4.plot: In this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Extraordinary Measures," "Legion," & "Crazy Heart," Ellen breaks down the Top 5 Acts of Vengeance in film and we interview Buck Smithee: Magic Consultant.

5.title: Edge of Darkness/When in Rome/Saint John of Las Vegas
5.plot: Brett and Ellen assemble with webcam reviews to tackle Edge of Darkness, When in Rome and Saint John of Las Vegas. Then set the definitive Top 5 I Love You's in Film before Valentine's Day.

14.title: Kick-Ass/Death at a Funeral/The Joneses
14.plot: This week's Rotten Tomatoes reviews Kick-Ass (2010), Death at a Funeral (2010), and The Joneses (2009). Plus, we run down the Top 5 Alternative Energy Sources in Movies. Brooke Shields shares her Five Favorite Films.

15.title: The Back-up Plan/The Losers/Paper Man
15.plot: The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a movie review show that airs on Thursday nights at 10:30 e/p on Current TV. From reviews of the newest releases to commentary on cult favorites and movie trends, each episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a fast-paced, comedic journey through the week in cinema.

16.title: Iron Man 2/Mother and Child/Harry Brown
16.plot: The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a movie review show that airs on Thursday nights at 10:30 e/p on Current TV. From reviews of the newest releases to commentary on cult favorites and movie trends, each episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a fast-paced, comedic journey through the week in cinema.

17.title: Robin Hood/Letters to Juliet/Just Wright
17.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, we review Robin Hood, Letters to Juliet, and Just Wright, a romantic comedy about falling in love with a famous athlete who's also your patient, starring Queen Latifah and Common. Plus, we scour our DVD collection to determine Russell Crowe's Top 5 Movie Lines, and Michael Caine sits down to share his Five Favorite Films

18.title: Shrek Forever After/Survival of the Dead/Holy Rollers
18.plot: The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a movie review show that airs on Thursday nights at 10:30 e/p on Current TV. From reviews of the newest releases to commentary on cult favorites and movie trends, each episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show is a fast-paced, comedic journey through the week in cinema.

19.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time/Sex and the City 2/MacGruber
19.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time (2010), Sex and the City 2 (2010), and MacGruber (2010), the new full-length feature based on a recurring Saturday Night Live sketch with Will Forte. Plus, we count down the Top 5 Television Show Remakes and Katherine Heigl stops in to share her Five Favorite Films.

20.title: The A-Team/The Karate Kid/Winter's Bone
20.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies The A-Team, Winter's Bone, and The Karate Kid, a remake of the 1980s hit, starring Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan. Plus, we count down the Top 5 Old Wise Dudes, and Russell Brand shares his Five Favorite Films while promoting Get Him to the Greek.

21.title: Toy Story 3/Cyrus/Jonah Hex
21.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies Toy Story 3, Jonah Hex, and Cyrus, starring John C. Reilly as a man who discovers his new girlfriend's 21-year-old problem child, Jonah Hill. Plus, we count down the Top 5 Anti-Heroes, and Brett Ratner shares his Five Favorite Films.

22.title: Knight and Day/I Am Love/The Killer Inside Me
22.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies Knight and Day (2010), I Am Love (2009), and The Killer Inside Me (2010), starring Casey Affleck as a Texas deputy sheriff who might also be a psycho murderer. Plus, we count down the Top 5 Tom Cruise Lines in movies, and James McAvoy shares his Five Favorite Films.

23.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse/The Last Airbender/Grown Ups
23.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies The Twilight Saga: Eclipse (2010), The Last Airbender (2010), and Grown Ups (2010), starring a team of comedy giants that includes Chris Rock, Adam Sandler, and Kevin James. Plus, Ellen counts down the Top 5 Worst Blockbusters and Jonah Hill shares his Five Favorite Films.

24.title: Despicable Me/The Kids Are All Right
24.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies "The Kids Are All Right" and "Despicable Me," an animated film about an evil mastermind (voiced by Steve Carell) determined to become the world's greatest thief. Plus, we get Secret Movie Confessions from the cast of The Sorcerer's Apprentice and Tilda Swinton shares her Five Favorite Films.

25.title: Inception/Predators/The Sorcerer's Apprentice
25.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies Inception (2010), Predators (2010), and The Sorcerer's Apprentice (2010). Plus, we get Helen Mirren's Secret Movie Confession and ask viewers to settle the score on the movie dumbest movie villain of all time.

26.title: Salt/Ramona and Beezus/Summer Doc Round-Up
26.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of this week's movies Ramona and Beezus (2010) and Salt (2010), starring Angelina Jolie as a CIA official accused of being a Russian spy. Brett shares Angelina Jolie's top five hottest parts. Plus, the hosts review a roundup of three summer documentaries: Restrepo (2010), 8: The Mormon Proposition (2010), and Winnebago Man (2009). Horror director George A. Romero shares his Five Favorite Films.

27.title: Dinner for Schmucks/Charlie St. Cloud/Get Low
27.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies Dinner for Schmucks (2010), Get Low (2009), and Charlie St. Cloud (2010)," starring Zac Efron as a young man who feels guilty for the death of his little brother after a tragic car accident. Plus, we count down the Top 5 Movie Dorks of all time, Brett sings a song about potty mouth kids in movies, and Kevin Kline shares his Five Favorite Films.

28.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World/Eat Pray Love/The Expendables
28.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies "Eat Pray Love," "The Expendables," and "Scott Pilgrim vs The World," starring Michael Cera as a twenty-something tasked with defeating his new girlfriend's seven evil exes in order to date her. Plus, they count down the Top 5 Worst Sylvester Stallone movies of all time, and Brett takes us through Julia Robert's high-grossing career in Three Minutes or Less.

29.title: The Switch/Middle Men/Lottery Ticket
29.plot: On this week's Rotten Tomatoes Show, Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead reviews of the movies "Lottery Ticket," "Middle Men," and "The Switch," starring Jennifer Aniston as a single woman who decides to get artificially inseminated and Jason Bateman as the neurotic best friend that accidentally destroys the donor sample and replaces it with his own. Plus, they count down the Top 5 Killers Animals in movies, and we get Secret Movie Confessions from the cast of "Get Low."

30.title: The Last Exorcism/Piranha 3D/Vampires Suck
30.plot: Reviews of The Last Exorcism (2010), _Piranha (2010)_, and Vampires Suck (2010). Ellen counts down the Top 5 Movie Heists and Ice Cube shares his 5 Favorite Films.

31.title: The American/Going the Distance/Machete
31.plot: Reviews of The American (2010), Machete (2010), and Going the Distance (2010). Ellen sums up George Clooney's movie career in three minutes or less.

32.title: The Town/I'm Still Here/Easy A
32.plot: Brett and Ellen lead reviews of The Town (2010), I'm Still Here (2010), and Easy A (2010). Stanley Tucci give his Five Favorite Films, and the Top Five Movie Sluts of all time.

1.title: Echelon Conspiracy/Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun Li/Crossing Over
1.plot: Reviews of Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li (2009), Echelon Conspiracy (2009) and Harrison Ford's Crossing Over (2009), and Ellen reveals the top five conspiracy movies of all time. The question posed: is there ever going to be a good video game movie?

2.title: Watchmen/Shuttle/12
2.plot: Reviews of "Watchmen," "Shuttle" and "12," and the top five movies with numbers in the titles, and the hosts try to learn history through film.

3.title: Miss March/Race to Witch Mountain/Sunshine Cleaning
3.plot: Reviews of "Miss March", "Race to Witch Mountain", and "Sunshine Cleaning". The top five road trip romances are unveiled and more wisdom from Alan Arkin.

4.title: Duplicity/Knowing/I Love You, Man
4.plot: Hosts Erlich and Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Duplicity", "Knowing", "I Love You, Man", Ellen teaches Brett How To Be A Man and John Cena breaks down his Five Favorite Films.

5.title: Monsters vs Aliens/The Haunting in Connecticut/12 Rounds
5.plot: Reviews of "Monsters vs Aliens," "The Haunting in Connecticut", and "12 Rounds", breaking down the Top 5 Movie Monsters & Aliens. Ellen takes a look at Acting Wrestlers.

6.title: Fast & Furious/Adventureland/Sugar
6.plot: Reviews of "Fast & Furious", "Adventureland", and "Sugar". Also the Top 5 Movie Car Chases and Brett fields the ultimate Baseball Movie All-Star Team.

7.title: Observe & Report/Gigantic/Hannah Montana: The Movie
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: 17 Again/State of Play/Crank High Voltage
8.plot: Reviews of "17 Again", "State of Play" & "Crank High Voltage". Lips and Robb Reiner from Anvil share their Five Favorite Rock & Roll Movies and Brett shows us how to make an age shift in the movies.

9.title: The Informers/The Soloist/Tyson
9.plot: Reviews of "The Informers," "The Soloist," & "Tyson,". With the Top 5 Movie Parties and the Girls' Guide to Getting What you Want.

10.title: Wolverine/Ghosts of Girlfriends Past/Battle for Terra
10.plot: Reviews of "X-Men Origins: Wolverine," "Ghosts Of Girlfriends Past," & "Battle for Terra". Used Movie Gadgets and Accessories with a break down the Top 5 Dead Mentors.

11.title: Star Trek/Rudo y Cursi/Next Day Air
11.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Star Trek," "Rudo y Cursi," and "Next Day Air," Brett reveals his Top 5 Spaceships and Ellen Learns How NOT to do a Drug Deal From Watching the Movies.

12.title: Angels & Demons/Management/The Brothers Bloom
12.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Angels & Demons," "Management," and "The Brothers Bloom," Sasha Gray shares her Five Favorite Films and Brett Defends Robots.

13.title: Terminator Salvation/Night at the Museum 2/Dance Flick
13.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Terminator Salvation," "Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian," & "Dance Flick," Ellen breaks down the Top 5 Bitches in the movies and Brett shares some unconventional travel tips.

14.title: Land of the Lost/The Hangover/Away We Go
14.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Land of the Lost," "The Hangover," and "Away We Go," director Errol Morris shares his Five Favorite Films and in anticipation of "Imagine That", Ellen breaks down the Top 5 Worst Eddie Murphy Movies.

15.title: Taking of Pelham 123/Imagine That/Moon
15.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of The Taking of Pelham 123 (2009), Imagine That (2009) and Moon (2009), rapper and actor Common shares his Five Favorite Films and in we celebrate Father's Day with the Top Five Movie Dads.

16.title: Year One/Whatever Works/The Proposal
16.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Year One," "Whatever Works," & "The Proposal," Brett breaks down the Top 5 Summer Camps in movie history and Ellen learns how to be a Lady Boss by watching the movies.

17.title: The Hurt Locker/My Sister's Keeper/Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
17.plot: Reviews of "The Hurt Locker," "My Sister's Keeper," & "Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen,". Brett celebrates Independence Day with the Top 5 Villains Against America in Movie History and we check out the Los Angeles Film Festival.

18.title: Public Enemies/Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs/The Stoning of Soraya M
18.plot: Reviews of "Public Enemies," "Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs," & "The Stoning of Soraya M,". Ellen Fox has "The Talk" with Michael Mann and Brett Can't Wait to tell Ellen his new theory about Maverick from Top Gun.

19.title: Brüno/Cheri/I Love You, Beth Cooper
19.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Brüno," "Cheri," and "I Love You, Beth Cooper," Brett tries to watch all 5 previous Harry Potter movies and Ellen learns Romantic Stalking by watching the movies.

20.title: Harry Potter & the Half-Blood Prince/(500) Days of Summer/Homecoming
20.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Harry Potter & the Half-Blood Prince," "(500) Days of Summer," & "Homecoming," they visit the Big Apple where movies get made and Brett delves into Zooey Deschanel's Top 5 Weapons of Enchantment.

21.title: The Ugly Truth/G-Force/Orphan
21.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "The Ugly Truth," "G-Force," & "Orphan," they hit Comic-Con and Brett finds out where "The River Runs Through It," in Vermont.

22.title: Funny People/In the Loop/Thirst
22.plot: Reviews of "Funny People," "In The Loop," & "Thirst," Charlene Yi from Paper Heart shares her Five Favorite Films, and Brett wants you for the Secret Government Agencies.

23.title: Julie & Julia/Paper Heart/G.I. Joe: The Rise of the Cobra
23.plot: Reviews of "Julie & Julia," "Paper Heart," and "G.I. Joe: The Rise of the Cobra,". Top 5 Movie Metaphors are also examined because of the South African alien Apartheid in District 9, and the first ever Foodie Awards for food performance in film.

24.title: District 9/The Time Traveler's Wife/The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
24.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

25.title: Inglourious Basterds/Post Grad/World's Greatest Dad
25.plot: Reviews of "Inglourious Basterds," "Post Grad," & "World's Greatest Dad,". Just in time to go back-to-school there is also a break down of the Top 5 Bullies in film.

26.title: The Final Destination/Big Fan/Halloween II
26.plot: Reviews of " The Final Destination," "Big Fan," & "Halloween II,". To celebrate Labor Day, the Top 5 Worst Jobs in the movies are reviewed.

27.title: 9/Tyler Perry's 'I Can Do Bad All by Myself'/Whiteout
27.plot: Reviews of "9," "Whiteout," & "Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All By Myself,". In addition "The Top 5 Hottest Women Trying to Kill You" list is compiled and hosts learn "How To Be a Therapist" from Watching Movies.

28.title: The Informant!/Jennifer's Body/Love Happens
28.plot: Reviews of "The Informant!" "Jennifer's Body," and "Love Happens,". Hosts try to "learn How To Dance" by Watching the Movies and they look for the Top 5 Worst Fad movies.

29.title: Surrogates/Pandorum/Fame
29.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of Surrogates (2009), Fame (2009), and Pandorum (2009), they examine obscure sports on the Rotten Tomatoes Sports Network and Brett breaks down the Top 5 Coolest Futures from the movies that he wishes he could live in.

30.title: Zombieland/A Serious Man/Whip It
30.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Zombieland," "A Serious Man," & "Whip It," to celebrate Oktoberfest Brett breaks down the Top 5 Best Drunks in the Movies and Ellen Learns How to Escape Prison by Watching the Movies.

31.title: Couples Retreat/Bronson/An Education
31.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Couples Retreat," "Bronson," & "An Education," Ellen find the Top 5 Most Inappropriate Kids Movies and we meet Buck Smithee: Accent Coach.

32.title: Where the Wild Things Are/Paranormal Activity/Law Abiding Citizen
32.plot: Hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Where the Wild Things Are," "Paranormal Activity," & "Law Abiding Citizen," Adam Goldberg shares his Five Favorite Films and we'll list the Top 5 Worst Parents in the Movies.

33.title: Saw VI/Cirque du Freak/The Vampire's Assistant/Amelia
33.plot: Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "Saw VI," "Amelia," & "Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant," Ellen celebrates Halloween with the Top 5 Creepiest Kids in the Movies and Brett shows us how to cook up a Bio Pic.

34.title: Michael Jackson's This Is It/The House of the Devil/Gentlemen Broncos
34.plot: Reviews of This Is It (2009), The House of the Devil (2009), and Gentlemen Broncos (2009)," as well as the Top 5 Worst Actor/Musicians.

35.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats/A Christmas Carol/Precious
35.plot: Reviews of "The Men Who Stare at Goats," "A Christmas Carol," & "Precious," as well as the Top 5 Stoners in the Movies and they meet Filmstradamus.

36.title: 2012/The Messenger/Fantastic Mr. Fox
36.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "2012," "Fantastic Mr. Fox," & "The Messenger," John Woo shares his Five Favorite Films and we'll explore the woes of dating vampires.

37.title: The Road/Ninja Assassin/Old Dogs
37.plot: In the this episode of The Rotten Tomatoes Show, hosts Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox lead ensemble reviews of "The Road," "Ninja Assassin," and "Old Dogs," we hear Ellen's Top 5 Oh Shit Moments and Brett's sermon on The Afterlife in Movies.

38.title: Up in the Air/Everybody's Fine/Brothers
38.plot: Reviews of Brothers (2009), Up in the Air (2009), and Everybody's Fine (2009), as well as the Top 5 Movie Teachers of All Time.

39.title: The Rotten Tomatoes Show Year Endies
39.plot: At the end of the year, there's only one thing left: Awards. Brett Erlich and Ellen Fox go through the entire year that was 2009 to bring you The Rotten Tomatoes Show Year-Endies.

-1.title: The Best of Science Fiction Movies
-1.plot: On this special edition of the Rotten Tomatoes show, we take a look at the world of science fiction movies; from spaceships, to time travel, to gadgets, to Star Wars.
